description.narrative: Project title: Study and Research on Election Media Coverage for the 2020 Parliamentary Elections in Georgia . Objective: promoting a transparent, credible and balanced media environment during the 2020 Parliamentary Elections in Georgia.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Outcome 1. 1/ Level of bias at monitored media outlets.
Output 1. 1.1.a/ # of TV stations outlets monitored before, during and immediately after 2020 Parliamentary Elections 1.1.b/ # of radio stations monitored before, during and immediately after 2020 Parliamentary Elections 1.1.c/ # of print outlets monitored before, during and immediately after 2020 Parliamentary Elections 1.1.d/ # of online publications monitored before, during and immediately after 2020 Parliamentary Elections 1.1.e/ # of sources from social networks analysed before, during and immediately after 2020 Parliamentary Elections 1.1.f/ # of TV stations monitored for the perceptions of outside influence on elections. 1.1.g # of TV stations monitored after 2020 Parliamentary Elections. 1.1.h/ # of print outlets monitored after 2020 Parliamentary Elections. 1.1.i/ # of online publications monitored after 2020 Parliamentary Elections. 1.2/ # of Media Monitoring reports produced 1.3/ Availability of on-line data analysis tool on the www.mediamonitor.ge for the findings of MM 2020 (Yes/No). 1.4/ # of public presentations (online if needed) for the dissemination of the findings of MM among media community, electoral subjects, academia & wider public.
Output 2. 2.1/ # of monitors with capacity to monitor gender equality aspects in elections. 2.2/ # of monitors with capacity to produce monitoring of social networks sites.

comment.narrative:
Outcome 1. 1/ Private media outlets demonstrate sharp polarization and clear bias, while the public broadcaster does not always ensure editorial independence and impartiality.
Output 1. 1.1/a No TV stations are monitored. 1.1.b/ No radio stations are monitored. 1.1.c/ No print outlets are monitored. 1.1.d/ No online outlets are monitored. 1.1.e/ No Social Network sites are monitored. 1.1.f/ No TV stations are monitored currently for the perceptions of outside influence on elections.1.2/ No media monitoring is conducted currently. 1.1.g/ No TV stations are monitored after 2020 Parliamentary Elections. 1.1.h/ No print outlets are monitored after 2020 Parliamentary Elections. 1.1.h/ No online publications are monitored after 2020 Parliamentary Elections. 1.3/ Website is operational but does not display MM results for parliamentary elections 2020. 1.4/ No media monitoring is conducted currently using the methodology in question.
Output 2. 2.1/ Monitors don't have capacity to monitor and report on gender equality aspects of elections media coverage. 2.2/ No monitors have capacity to monitor social networks sites (SNS) for quality of information in electoral context.

Outcome 1.
Output 1. 1.1.a/ 12 Georgian TV channels, including Channel I – GPB, Ajara TV – GPB, Mtavari, Rustavi-2, Imedi, Formula, Pirveli, Maestro, ObjecTV, Kavkasia, Palitra, PosTV, have been monitored from 16 June through 21 November before the 2020 Parliamentary elections; 1.1.b/ 10 radio stations, including Sakartvelos Radio – GPB, Tavisupleba, Imedi, Maestro, Palitra, Pirveli Radio, Hereti, Marneuli, Dzveli Kalaki, Samkhretis Karibche, have been monitored from 16 June through 21 November before the 2020 Parliamentary elections; 1.1.c/ 8 newspapers, including including Resonance, Akhali Taoba, Kviris Palitra, Alia, Asaval-Dasavali, Kronika +, Sakartvelo da Msoplio, Guria News, have been monitored from 16 June through 21 November before the 2020 Parliamentary elections; 1.1.d/ 11 online news portals, including ambebi.ge, interpressnews.ge, news.on.ge, netgazeti.ge, radiotavisupleba.ge, sputnik-georgia.com, sknews.ge, reginfo.ge, publika.ge, mpn.ge, kvira.ge, tabula.ge have been monitored from 16 June throug 21 November before the 2020 Parliamentary elections; 1.1.e/ approximately 100 social network sites, including those of electoral subjects, government members, Facebook pages with more than 40 000 subscribers, have been monitored with the use of CrowdTangle and BuzzSumo analytical tools before the 2020 parliamentary elections. 1.1.f/ 12 TV stations (news and talk-shows), including Channel I – GPB, Ajara TV – GPB, Mtavari, Rustavi-2, Imedi, Formula, Pirveli, Maestro, ObjecTV, Kavkasia, Palitra, PosTV, have been monitored in order to evaluate perceptions of outside influence on elections.
1.2.1/ 3 (three) pre-election MM reports have been produced (September, October, December 2020). 1.3/ Mediamonitor.ge website has been updated with media monitoring findings uploaded and available for public access. 1.4/ 3 (three) public discussions have been organized with the participation of the representatives of the media industry, civil society, election observer groups, academia and international stake holders.
Output 2. 2.1/ 45 monitors from Internews-Georgia and the Charter of Journalistic Ethics have been trained to monitor and report on gender equality aspects of elections media coverage, which have been incorporated into the findings. 2.2/ 6 monitors have been trained to conduct the monitoring of social network sites at professional level using analytical tools.

Ouput 1.
1.1.g/ 10 Georgian TV channels will be monitored during 2 months after 2020 Parliamentary elections; 1.1.h/ 8 newspapers will be monitored during 2 months after the 2020 Parliamentary elections. 1.1.i/ 11 online publications will be monitored during 2 months after the 2020 Parliamentary elections.
1.2.2/ 1 post-election MM report produced 1.2.3/ an overview / mapping of local media outlets produced in the run up to the 2021 local self-government elections
1.4/ 1 public discussions/presentations organized
